name: 4D Aligner Manufacturing - DMR III Standard Process
notes: Standard workflow for producing high-precision aligner trays. Material is UV-sensitive - follow light exposure guidelines carefully.

substeps.description: Power on iLuxPro Dental printer and wait for 5-minute warm-up cycle. Verify all indicator lights are green on the main panel.
Insert LEAP C+ resin tank into printer cartridge slot. Align blue label with the white indicator mark. Push firmly until you hear the click.
Open LuxFlow software on connected workstation. Select 'DMR III' material profile from dropdown menu.
Verify print bed is clean and dry. Wipe with lint-free cloth if necessary. Install print build platform by sliding into alignment rails until secure.
Load digital design file (STL format). Select 'Aligner Tray Standard' preset to auto-configure print parameters: XY resolution 25 microns, Z-layer 50 microns.
Review print preview on screen. Verify trays are positioned with adequate spacing (minimum 15mm between parts). Check estimated print time (typically 45-75 minutes for batch of 11 trays).
Click 'Start Print' button. System will perform automatic resin leveling and exposure calibration (approximately 90 seconds). Do not open printer during this phase.
Monitor print progress via console. Watch for any error warnings. System will automatically notify when print is complete.
Once complete, remove build platform and place on designated cooling tray. Allow 10 minutes for parts to set before handling.
Use plastic scraper tool to carefully remove trays from build platform. Start from one corner and work edges first. Angle platform at 45 degrees for easier removal.
Transfer printed trays to iLuxWash Dental wash station basket. Load maximum 12 trays per basket (do not overload).
Fill wash station with DMR III cleaning solution (specific solvent matched to material). Liquid level should reach marked line on tank side.
Insert basket into wash chamber. Select 'DMR III - Aligner' wash program on touchscreen. Typical cycle: 8 minutes standard wash, 3 minutes rinse.
At cycle completion, remove basket carefully. Inspect trays for any remaining resin residue. Rinse under distilled water if needed.
Transfer trays to air-dry rack. Position on clean surface in dark area. Allow 15-20 minutes air dry time before UV curing.
Preheat LuxOven Pro to 85°C. Allow 5-minute warm-up. Verify temperature on digital display before proceeding.
Load dried trays into oven-safe ceramic tray (maximum 12 trays). Space evenly to allow heat circulation. Do not stack.
Insert tray into oven center. Close door and select 'DMR III - Thermal Cure' program. Cure time: 10 minutes at 85°C.
At completion, carefully remove tray using thermal gloves. Place on cooling rack. Allow 20 minutes room temperature cooling before handling.
Transfer cooled trays to iLuxCure Pro UV chamber. Load maximum 12 trays per cycle in single layer.
Close chamber door. Select 'DMR III - Final UV Cure' from preset menu. Standard program: 20 minutes full spectrum UV exposure.
Once cycle completes, remove trays from chamber. Parts are now fully polymerized and ready for finishing operations.
Inspect each tray under bright LED light (minimum 500 lux). Check for surface defects, cracks, or discoloration. Compare against reference sample.
Measure tray dimensions using digital calipers at 3 points: width at widest point, height from base, and depth. All measurements must be within ±0.2mm of design specifications.
Mark any defective trays with red marker on underside. Set aside for rework queue. Segregate from approved batch to prevent mix-up.
Place approved trays into branded packaging box. Include silica desiccant packet. Seal box with company tape.
Apply label with: batch number, material type (DMR III), production date, quality inspector initials, and expiration date (2 years from production).
Store in cool, dark location (15-25°C, <60% humidity). Avoid direct sunlight exposure which can degrade UV-sensitive resin.
